alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Dakota; Hennepin; Ramsey (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:06PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Hennepin, north central Dakota, southern Anoka, Washington and Ramsey Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 505 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Roseville, or 6 miles northeast of Minneapolis, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Vadnais Heights around 515 PM CDT. St. Paul, Maplewood, West St. Paul and Mendota Heights around 520 PM CDT. Oakdale, White Bear Lake, South St. Paul and Mahtomedi around 525 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Woodbury, Lake Elmo, Afton and Bayport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 130 and 132. U.S. Highway 8 in Minnesota between mile markers 0 and 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Minnesota...and northwestern and west central Wisconsin.
